2304130.reference:
Reference  : Al-Adab Al-Mufrad 2304130
In-book reference  : Book 23, Hadith 001
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 23, Hadith 001
2304130.text: Salim ibn 'Abdullah reported from his father that 'Umar used to say to his sons, "Separate in the morning and do not meet together in the same house. I fear that you might split up or that some evil may take place between you."

2304140.reference:
Reference  : Al-Adab Al-Mufrad 2304140
In-book reference  : Book 23, Hadith 002
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 23, Hadith 002
2304140.text: Ibn 'Umar saw a shepherd with some sheep in a bad place and saw a place which was better than it. He told him, "Woe to you, shepherd! Move them! I heard the Messenger of Allah, may Allah bless him and grant him peace, say, 'Every shepherd is responsible for his flock.'"

2304150.reference:
Reference  : Al-Adab Al-Mufrad 2304150
In-book reference  : Book 23, Hadith 003
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 23, Hadith 003
2304150.text: Ibn 'Abbas reported that the Prophet, may Allah bless him and grant him peace, said, "We do not give a bad example. The one who takes back his gift is like the dog who returns to his own vomit."

2304160.reference:
Reference  : Al-Adab Al-Mufrad 2304160
In-book reference  : Book 23, Hadith 004
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 23, Hadith 004
2304160.text: Abu Hurayra reported that the Messenger of Allah, may Allah bless him and grant him peace, said, "The believer is guileless and generous while the corrupt is a swindler and miserly."
